# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

# Julia Solution for Adding Year and Month to DataFrame

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(Dates.year(x)) * string(Dates.month(x)), df.dt)
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a transformation to each element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame `df`. The transformation extracts the year and month from each date-time object using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions, then concatenates them together as an integer in the format "yyyymm" using string manipulation. Finally, it assigns this new column to `df[:ym]`.

To use this function with your DataFrame:

```julia
using DataFrames
# Assuming you have a DataFrame named df with a 'dt' column
df = ...  # Your DataFrame
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with the year and month of each date-time in the format "yyyymm".
